name: MBES
description: MBES maintains expenditure information for States and Federal Govt. for Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP).
longDescription: The Medicaid and CHIP Budget and Expenditure System (MBES/CBES) is a legally mandated system that was created to enable the states to submit budget and expenditure data to CMS for Medicaid and the Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP). MBES/CBES contains the following forms that the states submit quarterly to CMS: Form CMS-64, required under Title XIX of the Social Security Act (SSA), is an accounting statement that contains the following information: o	Amount of Medicaid grant funds that have been dispersed for a given quarter, as well as past fiscal years, o	Recovery of funds or refunds provided, o	Income earned on grant funds. Form CMS-21 is an accounting statement that shows a state’s recorded expenditures and disposition of Federal funds.  Most of the expenditures reported on this form are associated with starting and expanding health insurance coverage to include uninsured, low-income children through CHIP.  States are entitled to Federal reimbursement based on the actual expenditures shown in this form.
